description:
Mithra stands as one of the most righteous and powerful figures in Persian mythology. Known as "God of Covenants, Light, and Justice", this epithet captures the essence of their divine nature. 

According to Persian sacred texts, Mithra's origins reflect the eternal struggle between truth (Asha) and falsehood (Druj) The worship of Mithra became central to Persian religious practice, with devotees seeking their favor through fire temple ceremonies, ethical conduct, and ritual purity. 

The mythology surrounding Mithra reveals deep insights into Persian worldview, particularly concerning unknown and humanity's relationship with the divine. 

The legacy of Mithra extends far beyond ancient Persian civilization. Mithra's dualistic theology influenced later monotheistic religions. The ancient wisdom traditions continue to inspire modern Zoroastrian communities Scholars continue to study Mithra's mythology for its profound insights into Persian culture, religion, and philosophy.
